dismissalText.commentary: Misbah-ul-Haq not out 83 (91b 6x4 0x6 118m) SR: 91.2
Younis Khan c Jayawardene b Herath 72 (76b 4x4 0x6 108m) SR: 94.73

dismissalComment.html: Younis departs, well someone had to go for it now, he went for the sweep, got a top-edge that looped up tamely in the air for a catch to short fine leg, Herath has justified his selection ahead of Ajantha, Younis has set up a late charge from Pakistan

headshotImage.caption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Well, Pakistan have lost three wickets. Kamran has taken more than any of the Sri Lankan bowlers - two. After sending Hafeez back with his wily running, he's now accounted for himself with an inexplicable unremarkable charge down the track. He seemed to have decided long back that, no matter what, this had to go over long on. And so he proceeded - to run down the track like a bull that had seen a red rag. Herath just stuck to his guns, landed it on middle and got it to turn away, past Kamran's mad, mad swipe. Miss. He doesn't have much time to turn back. Sanga does the rest. He didn't even turn back. Just kept walking. Good idea too. Vintage Kamran.

Younis departs, well someone had to go for it now, he went for the sweep, got a top-edge that looped up tamely in the air for a catch to short fine leg, Herath has justified his selection ahead of Ajantha, Younis has set up a late charge from Pakistan

got 'em! Shehzad had shown signs of impatience the previous delivery, and this time he was lured into a drive outside off stump, it was pitched on a length, and moved away slightly to produce the fatal edge, bounced a lot more than usual too, and Sanga doesn't let go of those

headshotImage.caption: Abdul Razzaq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdul Razzaq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: high full toss, Razzaq had to go for maximum, and did so, but his swing produced a top edge that swirled high in the air and settled in the hands of extra cover, Sri Lanka will feel that they have restrained a Pakistan line-up that threatened to gallop away, but couldn't quite do so

dismissalText.commentary: Ahmed Shehzad c Sangakkara b Perera 13 (23b 2x4 0x6 24m) SR: 56.52

Shehzad had shown signs of impatience the previous delivery, and this time he was lured into a drive outside off stump, it was pitched on a length, and moved away slightly to produce the fatal edge, bounced a lot more than usual too, and Sanga doesn't let go of those

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez run out (Jayawardene/Sangakkara/Herath) 32 (31b 4x4 1x6 63m) SR: 103.22

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, is anyone out, who is out, what is happening, it was full on leg stump and swept to short fine leg, there was a terrible mix-up, Kamran ran all the way to Hafeez who did not move an inch, the throw came in to Sanga, there were two batsman there, so he threw to Murali, who would have had to be eight feet tall to take the wayward throw, but the ball was in the end relayed to Murali, Hafeez thought of running to Murali's end just for a fleeting moment, abandoned such foolish thoughts, and Murali finally got the bails off, it is Hafeez who has to walk back finally

dismissalText.commentary: Umar Akmal c Dilshan b Muralidaran 10 (15b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Umar goes, it was short, a rare one from Murali, in his eagerness to capitalise on the scarce offering, he pulled it in the air, got in a awkward position as he went through with the shot, and Dilshan took  sharp diving chance at deep midwicket, Murali has suffocated Pakistan in the Powerplay

dismissalComment.html: backs away and goes for the upper cut to a short and wide delivery, but cannot get it over Dilshan at point, who goes high at it with outstretched hands, and pouches it cleanly

dismissalText.long: st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman
dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman 57 (78b 5x4 0x6 115m) SR: 73.07

dismissalComment.html: Silva's vigil ends. Rehman can't believe it. Kamran's actually effected a stumping off his bowling. Silva dawdles out of the crease, he looks for the heave. Rehman smartly gets it to drift away from him, and gets it past his stretched swipe. Kamran collects and breaks the stumps. Even he looks sheepish.

dismissalText.long: c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi 49 (61b 2x4 1x6 109m) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: Captain strikes. Captain falls. How much of a contribution did Gul have to this dismissal? Sanga skips out of the crease. Afridi sees him and drops it short outside off. Sanga still wants to go over the top, so stops his initial shot and tries to cross-bat it over long on. Too ambitious. Shehzad runs in, tumbles forward and pouches. Finally someone doesn't let a stumping or a catch go.

boom booom strikes, it was too close for the cut, it was the one that went straight on, it was the one that kept low too, a deadly combination for Dilshan, who still went for the shot, and dinked it on to his stumps, Afridi stands mid-pitch with arms outstretched, has Pakistan's saviour arrived?

headshotImage.caption: Thilan Samaraweera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Thilan Samaraweera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shahid does the rope trick on Thilan, flights this one on middle, gets Thilan forward, and out of the crease, gets the ball to turn as well, Kamran does not mess up the take behind the stumps, in fact Thilan's foot is just out of the crease when Kamran takes off the bails, Shahid Afridi is one short of 300 ODI wickets

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Angelo is gone. Afridi has four. Shehzad has another catch. Angelo skips out of the crease, and Afridi sees him. He holds the length back and gets it to turn away. Angelo is forced to go with the shot and tries to cross-bat swipe it over long off. Mistimed, and it carries straight to Shehzad. Almost cleared the ropes, but not quite.

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the Rawalpindi Express is chugging in at full steam, and has broken through the defences of Mahela, lovely delivery, pacy, on a length and cutting in, Mahela drove outside the line, and the middle stump was pegged back, Shoaib first does the aeroplane thing, then points to himself as if to say 'I told you'

Shoaib Akhtar - rearranging stumps and landing like an aeroplane since 1997. What a legend. Thisara is gone. He finds out the hard way, than you can't set yourself up for pre-meditated slogs against the world's fastest. He moves the front foot away and looks to heave. Shoaib fires it full and fast, and removes the timber. Get ready for landing folks.

dismissalText.long: c Shahid Afridi b Mohammad Hafeez
dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Shahid Afridi b Mohammad Hafeez 33 (43b 6x4 0x6 64m) SR: 76.74

dismissalComment.html: well, I take that back. Hafeez has nailed Tharanga. As mentioned earlier, there is an army of green shirts inside the circle on the off side. Tossed up outside on leg, Tharanga drives on the up, and picks out Afridi at mid-off. He's thrilled after pouching the catch, tumbling forward. The game is back in the balance after Sri Lanka's recovery of sorts.

dismissalText.long: c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul 24 (14b 2x4 1x6 21m) SR: 171.42

dismissalComment.html: Gul has a wicket and Kula's free-scoring surge has come to an end. Not a yorker this time, it was a low full toss on leg stump and Kula couldn't get as much muscle under it as he would have wanted. Still went through with the shot, backing away and looking to launch it over long on. He found the fielder.

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: all over, after a lot of fuss. Pakistan had no business losing this, but they made a really solid effort. In the end, it was not enough, since Sri Lanka made more than their share of mistakes too. Murali backs away and looks to swing across the line, it hits his pads and goes to the leg side for a leg bye. Sighs of relief being heaved everywhere on the field

commentPostTextItems.html: Right, the World Cup has come alive finally. Here's hoping for another humdinger when India play England tomorrow. Apologies for the scoring glitch when Mathews got out today - the pressure seemed to get to us as well, a bit! In fact, the umpires for that wrong. Mathews faced the last ball of thr 43rd, which he hit for four, and the first ball of the 44th. And he got out in that over. So it goes.
On behalf of Abhishek and the rest of the team, this is Nitin Sundar signing off. Cheers!

Afridi is the Man of the Match. Finally, a bowling effort gets rewarded! " That was a big game. The way Misbah and Younis played - beautiful and very mature. The fielders relaxed a bit, but on a stage like this we can't do that. I am sure they will improve in the coming games. Good conditions for bowlers - spin and bounce. This is a strong message to other teams, we will come stronger, game after game!"

Sangakkara: "Quite a few positives - we bowled well on a flat deck, but lost three wickets at the wrong time. We got a good start, and needed players to bat long. Unfortunately, Pakistan played very well. Younis and Misbah kept picking singles well, but we did well to drag it back to 270. We got to keep going on - it is a long tournament and lot of games to win."

Misbah who did not take the field says there's nothing to worry with his niggle and he should be good in a couple of days. "It was keeping a little bit low, and in the first innings things were good for batting. I just wanted to be there till the end."

Well, we have finally seen a game go the distance - good development after a full week of the World Cup. What stood out today was that the experienced players stood up for Pakistan under pressure - Misbah, Younis, Afridi and Shoaib. You will see that happen a lot, when the going gets tough.

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul 24 (14b 2x4 1x6 21m) SR: 171.42

commentTextItems.html: Gul has a wicket and Kula's free-scoring surge has come to an end. Not a yorker this time, it was a low full toss on leg stump and Kula couldn't get as much muscle under it as he would have wanted. Still went through with the shot, backing away and looking to launch it over long on. He found the fielder.

two things that rarely happened today just happened. Gul landed a yorker. And Kamran pouched a tough catch. Superb ball this, follows Kula as he backs away and it goes right through him. Kamran dives to the left and collects. He stands up sheepishly and claps for Gul. A smile on the face too.
that's one of 'em four fours. Some finish this. Gul gives him just enough width outside off for Kula to swing his arms hard at it. It hits the outside edge, and flies away unimpeded to third man

right, he's got a single. Kula needs to hit more that four fours to win this game. Four fours will tie it. Full delivery on the stumps, another cross-batted heave and an inside edge to short fine leg, who does extremely well to dive and keep it down to one

commentPreTextItems.html: Gul has the ball, He's had a very poor day, but he's still the man for this.

commentTextItems.html: Herath can't connect. Back of a length and angling across, he looks to swing it away to the leg side. He misses. No surprises there. Kamran collects. Big surprise there.
that's the blow they needed. Kula connects with a low full toss on leg stump and thumps it over midwicket. 18 required off 6. Pakistan still ahead.

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Herath just sweeps. That's all he does all the time. Leg bye as he misses.
Kula searches for the hitting length, but Hafeez is keeping it real full. He manages to hit this reasonably well to long on, but the fielder keeps it away from the boundary
Herath gets another single through wide mid off, full on off stump and driven along the ground
dropped by Hafeez. Anyone keeping track of the drops? Full toss outside off, he slaps it back real hard and Hafeez can't hold on.

commentPostTextItems.html: Prem Panicker on twitter: "Watching Akmal keep is when I miss Boycott's grandmother the most"

commentPreTextItems.html: Hafeez to bowl. You read right. Round the wicket.

commentTextItems.html: nice bowling, saw Herath moving around, stopped and then delivered it full on off stump. He can't connect the sweep and gets a leg bye to the off side

Kula is not giving up just yet. Backs away to the leg side, and Shoaib responds with a bouncer on off stump. Kula keeps his cool and slaps it high over point for a couple before deep cover can get across.

commentPostTextItems.html: 29 required of 2. Rehman and Shoaib have bowled out.

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Rehman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Rehman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Kula manages to get under a nearly perfect yorker and loft it cleanly down to long on. Poor return from Umar Akmal, who runs across and fields, and they end up getting two
low full toss outside Herath's off stump and he drives it without enough power to wide long on for one
full length ball, searing in from outside off, and driven by Kula off the backfoot to extra cover for one

slow bouncer, Shoaib at his best. Herath can't even imagine a bumper at 111 kph, tries to duck, weave and eventually just stays out of the way as it flies slowly past his head. Kamran, as always, fumbles.

commentPreTextItems.html: Shoaib for his last over now.

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, Herath opens the face and steers straight to point
Herath sweeps with control and picks up a couple to end the over. Both teams have played quite badly in the recent past, and as a result this game is still open, though Pakistan are favourites.

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Rehman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Shahid Afridi b Mohammad Hafeez
dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Shahid Afridi b Mohammad Hafeez 33 (43b 6x4 0x6 64m) SR: 76.74

dismissalComment.html: well, I take that back. Hafeez has nailed Tharanga. As mentioned earlier, there is an army of green shirts inside the circle on the off side. Tossed up outside on leg, Tharanga drives on the up, and picks out Afridi at mid-off. He's thrilled after pouching the catch, tumbling forward. The game is back in the balance after Sri Lanka's recovery of sorts.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Shahid Afridi 41 (55b 5x4 0x6 81m) SR: 74.54

dismissalComment.html: boom booom strikes, it was too close for the cut, it was the one that went straight on, it was the one that kept low too, a deadly combination for Dilshan, who still went for the shot, and dinked it on to his stumps, Afridi stands mid-pitch with arms outstretched, has Pakistan's saviour arrived?

dismissalText.long: c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi 49 (61b 2x4 1x6 109m) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: Captain strikes. Captain falls. How much of a contribution did Gul have to this dismissal? Sanga skips out of the crease. Afridi sees him and drops it short outside off. Sanga still wants to go over the top, so stops his initial shot and tries to cross-bat it over long on. Too ambitious. Shehzad runs in, tumbles forward and pouches. Finally someone doesn't let a stumping or a catch go.

dismissalComment.html: the Rawalpindi Express is chugging in at full steam, and has broken through the defences of Mahela, lovely delivery, pacy, on a length and cutting in, Mahela drove outside the line, and the middle stump was pegged back, Shoaib first does the aeroplane thing, then points to himself as if to say 'I told you'

dismissalText.long: st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman
dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman 57 (78b 5x4 0x6 115m) SR: 73.07

dismissalComment.html: Silva's vigil ends. Rehman can't believe it. Kamran's actually effected a stumping off his bowling. Silva dawdles out of the crease, he looks for the heave. Rehman smartly gets it to drift away from him, and gets it past his stretched swipe. Kamran collects and breaks the stumps. Even he looks sheepish.

dismissalText.long: c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Ahmed Shehzad b Shahid Afridi 18 (20b 2x4 0x6 24m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: Angelo is gone. Afridi has four. Shehzad has another catch. Angelo skips out of the crease, and Afridi sees him. He holds the length back and gets it to turn away. Angelo is forced to go with the shot and tries to cross-bat swipe it over long off. Mistimed, and it carries straight to Shehzad. Almost cleared the ropes, but not quite.

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Akhtar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera b Shoaib Akhtar 8 (6b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Shoaib Akhtar - rearranging stumps and landing like an aeroplane since 1997. What a legend. Thisara is gone. He finds out the hard way, than you can't set yourself up for pre-meditated slogs against the world's fastest. He moves the front foot away and looks to heave. Shoaib fires it full and fast, and removes the timber. Get ready for landing folks.

headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul 24 (14b 2x4 1x6 21m) SR: 171.42

dismissalComment.html: Gul has a wicket and Kula's free-scoring surge has come to an end. Not a yorker this time, it was a low full toss on leg stump and Kula couldn't get as much muscle under it as he would have wanted. Still went through with the shot, backing away and looking to launch it over long on. He found the fielder.

dismissalText.long: st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman
dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva st Kamran Akmal b Abdur Rehman 57 (78b 5x4 0x6 115m) SR: 73.07

dismissalComment.html: Silva's vigil ends. Rehman can't believe it. Kamran's actually effected a stumping off his bowling. Silva dawdles out of the crease, he looks for the heave. Rehman smartly gets it to drift away from him, and gets it past his stretched swipe. Kamran collects and breaks the stumps. Even he looks sheepish.

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul
dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Umar Akmal b Umar Gul 24 (14b 2x4 1x6 21m) SR: 171.42

dismissalComment.html: Gul has a wicket and Kula's free-scoring surge has come to an end. Not a yorker this time, it was a low full toss on leg stump and Kula couldn't get as much muscle under it as he would have wanted. Still went through with the shot, backing away and looking to launch it over long on. He found the fielder.

seriesStandings.notes:
The following points system will apply: Win 2
Tie or no result 1
Loss 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points in its Group, the right to play in the quarter-finals will be decided in the following order of priority:
  • The team with the most wins in the Group matches will be placed in the higher position.
  • If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the Group matches then in such case the team with the higher net run rate in the Group matches will be placed in the higher position (refer below for the calculation of net run rate).
  • If following the net run rate calculation above there are teams which are still equal, then the team with the higher number of wickets taken per balls bowled in the Group matches in which results were achieved will be placed in the higher position.
  • If still equal, the team which was the winner of the head to head match played between them will be placed in the higher position.
  • In the highly unlikely event that teams cannot be separated by the above this will be done by drawing lots.

Quarter Final

  • If a quarter-final is tied, the teams shall compete in a one over per side eliminator to determine which team progresses to the semi-final. Refer to Appendix 7. here
  • If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the one over eliminator from being completed, or if the match is a no result, then the team that finished in the higher position in the Group stage shall proceed to the semi-finals.

Semi Final

  • If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a one over per side eliminator to determine which team progresses to the final. Refer to Appendix 7. here.
  • If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the one over eliminator from being completed, or if the match is a no result, then the team that finished in the higher position in the Group stage shall proceed to the final.

Final In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a one over per side eliminator to determine which team is the winner. Refer to Appendix 7. here. If weather conditions prevent the one over eliminator from being completed, the teams will be declared joint winners. In the event of a no result, provided weather conditions permit, the teams shall compete in a one over per side eliminator to determine which team is the winner. If weather conditions do not permit, the teams will be declared joint winners.

Net Run Rate A teams net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Note: Any play during a one over per side eliminator is excluded from these calculations. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2s Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. In circumstances where a match (and the points for such match) is awarded to a team as a result of the other teams refusal to play, either by the umpires in accordance with Law 21.3 (a)(ii) or in accordance with the provisions of the relevant event agreements signed by the participating teams, the net run rate of the defaulting team shall be affected in that the full 50 overs of the defaulting teams innings in such forfeited match shall be taken into account in calculating the average runs per over of the defaulting team over the course of the relevant portion of the competition. For the avoidance of doubt the runs scored and overs bowled in such forfeited match will not be taken into account when calculating the net run rate of the team to whom the match was awarded.
